cosc.cosc455.rsanzone.project1

Class LexicalAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cosc.cosc455.rsanzone.project1.LexicalAnalyzer

  • public class LexicalAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class LexicalAnalyzer takes file data in the form of a string and breaks it up into valid tokens.
    Author:
    Ronald Sanzone

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  LexicalAnalyzer.LexicalErrorException
      The Class LexicalErrorException that is used to throw an error if an invalid token is found.

    • Field Detail

      • SPACE

        private final char SPACE
        Character constant used for the to represent a space
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINE_SEPARATOR

        private final char LINE_SEPARATOR
        Char constant that represents a line separator. Use '\n' because the JVM will convert it to the appropriate system line separator.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • curPos

        private int curPos
        The current position in the given file data string.

      • lineNum

        private int lineNum
        The current line number.

        private java.lang.String file
        The String containing the data from the input file.

      • tokens

        private Tokens tokens
        Token class that is used to store token data

    • Constructor Detail

      • LexicalAnalyzer

        public LexicalAnalyzer(java.lang.String filecontents)
        Instantiates a new lexical analyzer and sets the file contents as the passed string.
        Parameters:
        filecontents - the string containing the file data

    • Method Detail

      • lex

        public void lex()

        Lex method that moves the lexical analyzer forward.

        Gets the next token and sets it to the global compiler variable.

      • getToken

        public Tokens.TagObject getToken()
        Gets the next token from the file. The token is either a tag or plaintext. Uses the lookup() method to test tags, otherwise just returns the plaintext token.
        Returns:
        the token

      • isWhiteSpace

        public boolean isWhiteSpace(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if the passed string is only white space.
        Parameters:
        s - the string
        Returns:
        true, if s is white space

      • skipWhiteSpace

        public Tokens.TagObject skipWhiteSpace()
        Skip white space method. Just recalls the getToken() method to move onto the next token in the file
        Returns:
        the next tag object

      • processTag

        public java.lang.String processTag()
        Process tag method. Processes a token that is determined to be a tag token. Checks first for a one word token then if needed checks for a two word token
        Returns:
        the tag token

      • getOneWord

        private java.lang.String getOneWord()
        Gets the one word from the file string. Looks for spaces and line separators to determine end of word.
        Returns:
        the one word

      • processText

        public java.lang.String processText()
        Process a token that is determined to be plain text. Looks for a # to determine the end the plain text and the start of a tag.
        Returns:
        the string containing plaintext

      • advChar

        public void advChar()
        advChar method increments the current position in the file string by one.

      • getChar

        public char getChar()
        Gets the char at the current position determined by curPos variable.
        Returns:
        the char

      • charRemaining

        public boolean charRemaining()
        Determines the amount of characters left in the file string.
        Returns:
        true, if current position is less than the file length.
        or false, if current position is greater than the file length.

      • lookup

        private Tokens.TagObject lookup(java.lang.String token)
        Looks up the passed token by comparing the token string to a HashMap of token value, token object pairs.
        Parameters:
        token - the string of the token value
        Returns:
        the tag object

      • hasTailingTokens

        public boolean hasTailingTokens()
        Checks for tailing tokens. Used to make sure that there are no tokens after the expected end of file
        Returns:
        true, if there are trailing tokens
